title: Surfline Lands In Western Region
text:
17:12 CET Surfline Lands In Western Region By Daily Guide 
Surfline, a wholly-owned Ghanaian telecommunications company, has extended its operations to Takoradi in the Western Region. 
Surfline aims to provide customers with unrivalled internet service in Ghana. 
The teleco has already launched its fourth-generation (4G) Long Term Evolution (LTE) network to boost the local internet industry. 
Surfline is the first firm to deploy 4G LTE services in the Western Region. 
This came to light when some officials of the telecommunications company paid courtesy calls on Deputy Western Regional Minister, Alfred Ekow Gyan and the Paramount Chief of Essikado Traditional Area, Nana Kobina Nketiah V. 
The officials were there to formally inform their hosts about the start of the operations of the company in Takoradi. 
Edwin Amoako, Branding and Communications Manager of Surfline, explained that Surfline, which has deep understanding of the Ghanaian culture, would provide unrivalled data communication services to customers. 
Mr Amoako noted that Surfline's operations in Takoradi would redefine internet for individuals and businesses in the Western Region. 
He stated 'our experiences over the past years and our strategic partnerships with world-class brands like Alcatel Lucent, IBM, Microsoft, Huawei and Oracle have enabled us to build a robust and reliable network. 
'We want to provide LTE-based services that will outperform existing telcos, because Surfline has the largest one-time deployment of the 4G LTE network in Africa,' Amoako added. 
From Emmanuel Opoku, Takoradi
